reviews.review: This is the the best co-op game I've played for the PC *besides Swat 4*. It's worth the money if you ask me. Many servers with many people in them are available which is fantastic.

L O D S O F E M O N E
What's that spell? LOADSAMONEY! Prob'ly.
Ótimo jogos para jogar com o amigos em co-op, recomento para os amigos que querem se divertir juntos

Killing Floor is a great game to play, especially if you have your own server and friends to play on it with.  The workshop, although limited, help the game out a lot, especially for newbies.  The gameplay is relatively different on each map and there are a lot of maps to choose from.  Again, the workshop is still expanding, but the custom maps are also fun.  However, this game is a big hit or miss.  You will either love it or hate it, and there are few in between.  It is mainly just surviving with waves, and a lot of the time, especially on higher difficulties, all you do is sit and camp.  There are a lot of "newer" players that can ruin the experience as well since they tend not to use filters when finding games.  With all these bad traits though, if you can look over them, it is definitely worth getting it, especially since the game is on sale 2 - 4 times a year.  Dropping 20 bucks seem like a reasonable price, although I would recommend just waiting for a sale, considering that fact that is can be a swing or miss.  I personally like the game, but I dont think I would pay 20 for it (anymore atleast).

Oh sweet heavenly carnage. Zombie/ monster games are a craze nowadays, and because of that, most tend to become follow the same old boring "zombie shooter", failing to stand out much. That doesn't mean they are bad, just uninventive. But not this game.
  
 Again, oh sweet heavenly carnage! This is one of those games were you have enough ammo to pump those little crawleys full of elad, and feel satisfied about it. The weapons are galore and awesome, the monsters are diverse, tactical, scary, and sometimes even disturbing(You gotta love events!). This game will actually manage to scare you the first few times you turn around to see yourself being smiled at point-blank by a cloth(the slow creepy guy that blocks your movement). Oh and those british voices are bloody awesome! You just won't resist lighting up a smile when you hear something so caracteristically british from yourself or your allies.

 So to sum up: You got kewl awesome weapons, kewl classes(forgot to mention),kewl monsters, riddiculously funny and absurd english accents(and some other DLC ones 2), AND unlimmited carnage? What more can you want?
                                                                                  9/10- Just play the bloody game.

Ce jeu est vraiment génial, mais avec l'interface actuelle, le nombre de majs inutiles, et les serveurs à la c**, il fait bien rager parfois. Aujourd'hui par exemple j'ai passé une heure sur le jeu, pour environ 20 mins de jeu réel.
Les graphismes sont pas mal, mais le vrai exploit c'est d'avoir fait des graphismes de qualité avec le moteur d'UT2004, qui est sortit en 2002, et qui est vraiment dégueulasse pour maintenant : http://pwrcords.files.wordpress.com/2012/03/ut2004_screen001.jpg
Et la VF est inqualifiable.

Great wave based survival, but outdated graphics. Satisfying guns, good mapcount, guns, and mods. Never got my own server working, so my friends just joined some random server, so our mods were limited.

If there's one thing I admire, it's a developer supporting their game long after release.  Killing Floor has been updated with content (a lot of it free) so often that Tripwire Interactive is one of my favorite developers.  But enough about them, let's talk about the game.

Killing Floor is a mutant (not zombie and you will be stoned if you refer to them as zombies) survival game.  The premise is that an experiment has gone wrong, mutants emerge, blah blah blah, you've heard it before.  We're not here for the story, we're here for the guns and the killing.  Though one interesting bit about the backstory is that originally it was the military and police dealing with the mutants, but now everyone is in on the fun.  You have DJ's wielding katanas, a guy in a chicken suit, santa clause, and even the pyro from Team Fortress 2.

The game takes place in the UK, with hilariously over the top stereotypes for each person.  From the accent to the forms of swearing, you'll find yourself spamming in game commands just to hear all the things they can say.

You'll find yourself in various locations.  The game does support custom maps, but the maps Tripwire have made themselves are amazing as well.  You'll find in labs, carnivals, and even the ruins Aperture Laboratory.  Some have gimmicks like elevators and what not that will allow you to escape from the mutants.

Speaking of mutants, there are tons of mutants.  You have the Clot, your standard peon.  Be aware of it's grab though, it'll root you in place.  The Gorefast is an upgraded version that can run, but also possesses a longer attack range.  The Stalker can turn invisible and the Crawler jumps around.  Both are easy to kill though.  There are your fat zombies, Bloats, who not only puke on you, but will also explode in a shower of puke when you shoot them too much in the torso.  You have Sirens, mutants in straight jackets that will scream, disabling your grenades and doing pure health damage.  Husks will prevent you from camping by shooting fireballs at you.  Now for the big ones, for which you will need big guns.  The Scrake has a chain saw, get him to half health and he'll charge you.  Same with the Fleshpound, but more frightening.  With two spiked gloves, he'll become enraged and chase you.  At the end of every game, you'll face a Patriarch, armed with a chain saw and rocket launcher to cover the distance.  Get to close and he'll smack you.  Do too much damage and he'll run, turn invisible and heal.  So how do you kill him?  Keep pounding him with all you got and don't give him time to rest.

Of course, to help you kill all these things is a vast arsenal.  You have assault rifles, shotguns (pump, semi, and fully auto), handguns, smg's, snipers, explosives, and even make-shift weapons.  Supporting you are also perks.  Like to blow stuff up?  Equip the demolition perk.  Shotguns are your thing?  Equip the Support Specialist perk.  There's a perk for everyone.

TL:DR - Horde style survival game, played best with friends (up to 6 people, more can be supported with mods).  May get repetitive, but if that's the case, maybe you should try a map other than West London.

Max level is an INSANE grind for most classes but the game stays fresh and difficult for hours (I still cant beat the highest diff maps).

One of my favorite FPS games of all time. The community is great, the shooting mechanics feel fantastic, there's a lot of variety in the maps (especially when you include the community-made ones) and it's always a deent challenge even after playing for hundreds of hours, making for a lot of replayability. It's got the perfect mix of gore and dark humor, and the animations when you score a headshot or a particularly large explosion are very satisfying. My only criticism is the in-game voice chat, as it's pretty bad quality, but then again most in-game chat is so use Mumble or Teamspeak with friends and you'll be fine. One of the best zombie shooters out there by far.

Aged, but still a fun game. This might sound weird but I suggest finding a friend that owns the game already, and play it for yourself to see if you'll like it. Imagine Left 4 Dead with waves of monsters that are much more dangerous. More grounded so-to-speak. The leveling system definatly takes some dedication to get maxed out in the class you play.

HIGHLY suggested to have a few friends to play this with. Can't suggest that enough. You COULD play with strangers, but the joy you get playing/improving with your friends in this is fantastic.

This game is stupidly fun, I didn't think that I'd like it at first but I finally caved. Playing with friends is amazing, the guns are great, the mechanics are nice, and killing a few hundred mutants while listening to an intense playlist leads to a great time. I highly recommend it.

Killing Floor is one of those games that you want to grab a few of your buddies and say. "Hey let's try this out." With hours of non-stop action packed waves of constant horrifying zombie Ai, the game is constantly pushing you to finishing each wave faster to grab the next biggest gun you can buy. With the games unique selection of class types varying from a dead-eye Sharpshooter to an explosive Demolitionist, Tripwire Interactive has woven together a great game for all those out there who love to play fast paced shooters greatly based on teamwork and of course firepower.

Great co-op survival game!  Up to 6 people on the team with great weapons and maps that both update on a regular basis.  I played MW3 Survival and consider KF to be at least as good (even though it is a lot cheaper and older).  A big plus is that you can always find games and people to play - it's far more popular compared to MW3 survival.

I wont say much more but you gotta experience this 10/10 right here< :D

Killing Floor é um jogo em primeira pessoa, de terror e de waves de zumbis, waves são uma certa quantidade de inimigos que virão ao mesmo tempo, e a cada wave que passa vai ficando mais difícil. KF é um jogo bem legal de jogar com os amigos e meio enjoativo jogar sozinho, o jogo não tem história, é bastante focado no Multiplayer mesmo. Os gráficos são bem ruinzinhos, os desenvolvedores não deram muita atenção a isso, mas a jogabilidade e boa e tem umas armas legais e bem variadas, você pode escolher um personagem, mas são poucos, mas se comprar todas as DLCs, você terá bastante personagens para escolher. A variedade de inimigos e até que grande, e o último chefe e um pouco apelão kkk. Resumindo, Killing Floor é um jogo bacana, eu achei meio enjoativo, mas dá pra passar o tempo as vezes.

Jogabilidade: 10/10
Gráficos: 5/10
Movimentação: 7/10
História: 0/10
Hammer

A good shooter that in my opinion, is better than L4D. You have a lot of variety in classes and weapons and of course, that brit humour is always there. For those who like violent shooters, zombies(specimens),gore and horrendous scenarios, this is the game for you.

EDIT: Killing Floor 2 is now fully released.

I've been playing Killing Floor for years and it is without a doubt one of my favourite games here.

+ The combat and carnage is unparalleled: explosions, dismemberment, and headshots look and sound great
+ The class and perk system is incredibly robust: classes have unique roles, pros/cons, levelling is addictive
+ Huge variety of weapons and maps adds a ton of replayability
+ Best free seasonal updates of any game out there

Fair warning, this is a skill-based game and it is difficult. Newcomers should start on Normal difficulty to learn the ropes and have fun. Playing on Suicidal and Hell On Earth requires a lot of experience, working as a team, and in-depth knowledge of game mechanics. For many people however - myself included - this is the real draw of the game. If you put in the time, playing on HoE with 5 other experienced players all working together is some of the most fun you can have online. There is also nothing more exhilarating than being the last one alive on Wave 10 knowing your entire team is watching and relying on you to stay alive.

Highly recommended.

Hours upon hours of mindless, shooty fun - this game doesn't break any new ground when it comes to innovation, but who needs that anyway? You shoot monsters until you kill the boss. It's an age-old adage that the game doesn't shy away from, and in fact enhances the gameplay since you just focus on one thing: killing monsters. 

You get to pick from a variety of classes to help accomplish this playground of pew pew and chop chop, adding a sense of progress as you level up your class' skillset to better accommodate your playstyle. If the game feels too simple, bump up the difficulty and try and survive with more experienced teammates - the experience changes dramatically. 

If you're looking for some quick fun and mindless violence, feel free to pick up Killing Floor and run through the rounds with up to five other players. It's absolutely worth it!

Killing Floor is a horde mode zombie shooter thats co-op..WAIT DONT LEAVE ITS ACTUALLY REALLY GOOD. First off is the graphics ive seen better but its very nice, especially for 2009, and especially for the unreal engine. The guns are very intersting from assult rifles, to shotguns, to crossbows, to a gun that shoots flares. The enemies arec varied and interesting, ranging from the basic "clot" to sword armed "gorefasts" to the horror inducing "fleshpounds". The gameplay is solid, while basic, can be very deep. You'll find yourself welding doors to create choke-points, and using your classes to an advantage, you sharpsjhooters take care of the big guys while the flamethrowers and shotguns take out the smaller enemies. There is a perk system with each level improving damage and even getting discounts on perk based weapons. there are some drawbacks the game is a little too easy on the easier difficultys but thats changed with a simple increase of difficulty. The voice acting can be really annoying and eventually gets on your nerves.I kcould go on for a while but just know this, its messy, bloody, midless fun that you can play with 5 friends. i heartily recommed it. 9/10

Epic game! I would say even better that L4D2 because it has more variety of zombies and there are new maps coming with every update! You can choose between multiple classes, for example Commando, Firebug, Demolitionist... Every class has its own unique weapons and also gameplay mechanics vary between them. There is a standard game mode, where you kill zeds in waves until you beat the patriarh and there is also special Killing Floor Objective mode, which is more storyline based. I recommend playing this game with at least one friend because he'll try to teach the basics of the game. My rating of this game would be 9/10. It's a must buy whenever you need a good FPS, or some fun killing the zeds and killing then in Zed time :D That's all for now folks, I'l you guys in the next review :P

If you have Killing Floor, you most probably have played Left 4 Dead. This game excels at bringing out the Co-op elements of the Horror Survival type games and rewards players for playing as a full fledged team in six player wave based modes. And by playing as a team, I mean buy C4s at the last wave.

Based on a mod from the Unreal Tournament 2 Engine, Killing Floor captures the excitement and fear of a action horror survival series perfectly. Good team work is essential and is definitely not for the lonewolf players who will find themselves constantly at the short end of the stick and spectating for the remainder of the match. Provideds a decent dose of excitement and adranline rush each round. Each round starts and ends with a small amount of cash to arm yourself at the local weapons dealer store. Kills and surviving the round nets you more moolah to get bigger and more awesome boomsticks. Game ends with either you and your buddies killing the finale boss or your team being wiped out. Either all, this game gives you countless hours of fun and turning the player from hunter into hunted. 4 out of 5 for me.
